title: Minimum wage hike impacts labor market and sparks debate on public transport fares
subtitle: Report automatically generated on 2026-01-13 by the Trade Section, EU Delegation to Colombia
summary: The Colombian labor market faces significant adjustments following a substantial 23% increase in the minimum wage, affecting payroll costs for businesses and potentially leading to difficult decisions for companies and workers [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]]. Concurrently, the government is questioning a proposed fare increase for TransMilenio in Bogotá, arguing it lacks justification despite the system's claims related to minimum wage adjustments [[REF:624d95c5-12c4-4917-a36b-c79ccf14d9b8]]. These economic shifts occur amidst broader economic discussions on inflation trends within OECD countries [[REF:5b6421ce-5129-49fb-a4ff-6d60407f595e]] and the rising prices of essential food items like coffee and meat due to climate change [[REF:a4d13076-a52d-4e41-8a01-46275a15dc5d]].
key_findings: Minimum wage hike creates significant labor market adjustments and potential business challenges [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]].
Government disputes justification for Bogotá's public transport fare increase [[REF:624d95c5-12c4-4917-a36b-c79ccf14d9b8]].
OECD inflation eased to 3.9% in November, driven by food price moderation [[REF:5b6421ce-5129-49fb-a4ff-6d60407f595e]].
Climate change contributes to rising prices of coffee, tea, and meat [[REF:a4d13076-a52d-4e41-8a01-46275a15dc5d]].

sections.title: Labor Market Adjustments Amid Minimum Wage Increase
sections.body: The Colombian labor market is navigating a significant shock at the start of 2026 due to a substantial 23% increase in the minimum wage [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]]. This rise has reconfigured payroll costs and initiated internal adjustments across the salary structure, creating a 'domino effect' on employment sustainability [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]]. Experts suggest this will lead to difficult decisions for both businesses and workers, impacting the formal employment landscape [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]].

sections.title: Government Challenges Public Transport Fare Hike
sections.body: The National Government, through the Ministry of Transportation, has questioned the justification for a $350 fare increase in TransMilenio, Bogotá's public transport system [[REF:624d95c5-12c4-4917-a36b-c79ccf14d9b8]]. While TransMilenio cited a 10.9% increase due to the minimum wage hike, the government argues that the minimum wage adjustment does not warrant such a fare hike [[REF:624d95c5-12c4-4917-a36b-c79ccf14d9b8]]. This dispute highlights tensions between public service operators and national economic policy objectives.

sections.title: Inflationary Trends and Economic Outlook
sections.body: The overall inflation rate across OECD countries stood at 3.9% in November, marking a decrease attributed largely to food prices [[REF:5b6421ce-5129-49fb-a4ff-6d60407f595e]]. Food inflation specifically fell to 4% in November, though energy prices saw a slight increase to 3.5% [[REF:5b6421ce-5129-49fb-a4ff-6d60407f595e]]. In contrast, Costa Rica remains the only OECD member with negative inflation [[REF:5b6421ce-5129-49fb-a4ff-6d60407f595e]]. Separately, the European Central Bank reported that coffee, tea, cocoa, sweets, and meat prices surged in 2025, partly due to climate change, contributing over 50% to annual food inflation in recent months [[REF:a4d13076-a52d-4e41-8a01-46275a15dc5d]].

sections.title: Political Developments and Governance Issues
sections.body: President Gustavo Petro issued a strong warning to the National Liberation Army (ELN), stating that joint military operations with Venezuela will occur if the group does not commit to peace and abandon Venezuelan territory [[REF:ad721b43-7f12-47c6-afc5-9771ceafaa53]]. This ultimatum underscores the government's stance on illicit economies and child recruitment [[REF:ad721b43-7f12-47c6-afc5-9771ceafaa53]]. In related governance news, allegations of political pressure on RTVC contractors have surfaced, with claims that job continuity is being conditioned on political support and active participation in electoral processes [[REF:a22acaff-7aa1-4a3d-a2fe-e9e544f10452]]. These pressures, allegedly captured on video, raise concerns about the integrity of public service employment [[REF:a22acaff-7aa1-4a3d-a2fe-e9e544f10452]].

sections.title: Economic Forecasts and Sectoral Performance
sections.body: The national economy faces an uncertain outlook for 2026, with expectations influenced by upcoming parliamentary and presidential elections [[REF:9f058851-0697-49db-abde-a581e9bb6ecd]]. Despite the uncertainty, there are hopes pinned on a change of government for economic improvement [[REF:9f058851-0697-49db-abde-a581e9bb6ecd]]. Recent manufacturing data for September 2025 showed growth in production and sales compared to the previous year, indicating a positive trend in the industry and commerce sectors [[REF:9f058851-0697-49db-abde-a581e9bb6ecd]]. Meanwhile, the Ministry of Health projects a payroll increase of $59.403 million for 2026, involving the creation of 442 new formal positions amidst ongoing system crises [[REF:e18ec143-d191-4047-ab4b-acda923ac265]].
